intro: Doronicum claytonii, commonly known as Clayton's leopard's bane, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of the western United States. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features basal leaves that are oval to lance-shaped with a hairy texture. The plant produces yellow flowers in late spring to early summer, arranged in loose clusters at the top of the stems. Its flowers have five petals and are often marked with darker veins, giving them a distinctive appearance. Doronicum claytonii thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or rocky slopes.
